pull.title: Add uncontroversial RBF base features
pull.body:
- add option to set nSequence in createrawtransaction
- add nSequence option to bitcoin-tx
- Refactor `CreateTransaction` (remove sign-bool and make use of bit flags)

events.message: [RPC] createrawtransaction: add option to set the sequence number per input

events.body:
The uncontroversial commits of #7159.
Is unclear how we allow opt-in-RBF over RPC and in the GUI.
One proposal would be to add a command `alterrawtransaction` (that could support setting the opt-in nSequence for all inputs of the provided rawtx. The command could also take care of increasing the fees).
Was https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7159 controversial?  I don't even see a NACK?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -334,6 +334,7 @@ UniValue createrawtransaction(const UniValue& params, bool fHelp)
             "       {\n"
             "         \"txid\":\"id\",    (string, required) The transaction id\n"
             "         \"vout\":n        (numeric, required) The output number\n"
+            "         \"sequence\":n    (numeric, optional) The sequence number (will overwrite RBF opt-in)\n"
comments.body: Perhaps the will override comment is a bit confusing with the functionality missing?   maybe add a "in future"?
